name: Hotel Amarano Burbank

reviews.text: I've stayed here 3 times on business, for a couple nights each time. The location is good for getting to the movie studios. The room is gorgeous, clean. I've never had a problem with the service. My only complaint is their fitness centre, which is really just a tiny (like the size of a living room). I like to work out when I am travelling so this is important to me. Maybe the machines have been updated by now, but on all my previous visits they only had a handful of ancient cardio machines. The space is really small, so it's extremely hot and difficult to breath. Shame they have such a terrible gym (only speaking about the cardio area) for an otherwise fantastic hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel except for the fitness centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed over a weekend in mid-January and we were pleasantly surprised. It had a small boutique hotel ambience with a very comfortable martini bar off the lobby which served excellent drinks and Tapas. The service was was good in all respects and the night manager even picked up our taxi tab from the airport. Clean rooms and quiet (we were on the back side away from the street but overlooking another building). Over-all excellent experience. Neighborhood was fine but certainly not fancy. A short walk to a nice selection of restaurants on Riverside Dr. Nice cozy outdoor spa and seating area on the top (4th) floor. Try to get a room on the 3rd or 4th floors on the street - they have a view of the mountains - don't know if there would be any concern over noise.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our second time and although not as new, the stay was still great. Room has everything you need, microwave, kitchen supplies, wireless internet, big flat screen tv, comfortable bed with feather duvet and comfy pillows. Service was great from check in, car valet and maid service with nightly turn down service. Complimentary starbucks in the morning and free newspaper. We had a room on the first floor with a small patio and two chairs which was nice. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, comfortable room

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple of nights for a business trip. I initially was a little doubtful about how it would end up because they placed me on a first floor room, so I was expecting a noisy night. On the contrary, I had the best sleep in this hotel than I ever had on my business travel in the recent weeks. Room service was pretty good and prompt (about a 15 minute wait). The room was very clean and seemed recently updated. I will definitely use this hotel when I am in Burbank again for business.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who are cost conscious, there is no self-parking, so each guest must use the $26/night valet parking service.
reviews.title: This is a good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a surprising gem in Burbank. It is not in the best area you would expect for a boutique hotel: located in a lower-middle class but safe-looking neighborhood. It is right down the street from some film studios, and is in a very central location for places like Universal Studios, Glendale, and Hollywood. If you want to go someplace nice to eat, you will have to drive, there is no convenient mass transit nearby.
reviews.title: Very good boutique hotel next to movie studios

likes.disliked: — Valet parking in the San Fernando Valley???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I had was furnished in a similar style to a Four Seasons hotel room, with a long dresser and work table along one wall and a flat panel TV on top. It also had nice amenities, very luxurious robes, a frig, a nice counter for the coffee machine, good lighting, lots of dimmable lamps, and a large bathroom.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels in Hollywood!

likes.liked: — Room was very modern and very clean
likes.disliked: — The only thing I wish is that I could have stayed longer!

reviews.text: Probably the most interesting thing about the room were the little sensual decorating touches that you might associate with Hollywood or Las Vegas. The artful black & white photos on the wall, which I thought were hillsides, turned out to be people's backsides (very tastefully done). A huge mirror alongside the bed. A strange upholstered thing on the wall with a short straight rod sticking out of the top of it, which at first I thought was an odd clothes hook, and then I decided must instead be for some kind of bondage adventure.
reviews.title: nice Hotel, not so great service
great hotel!
reviews.text: As the Oct-2007 reviewer complained, there is only pricey valet parking available, and the parking attendants as of Jan-2008 are still not very attentive or responsive. E.g., I called ahead for the car but no one brought it out front until I showed up in the lobby. Offering to take my luggage in/out of the hotel was an afterthought.
Despite the parking problem, an excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Upscale Hotel for a resonable price!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Amarano for one night in August - it was the night of my wedding. I was not impressed. It was hardly a bad hotel - it's certainly clean, the rooms are fairly well appointed and if you're into hotels for this reason, the entertainment system is top-notch.
reviews.title: Expensive even for Burbank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, as has been said in previous reviews, the service is not great. The staff are not unfriendly, but they all appear to be somehow socially inept - acting as though speaking to other people is a real strain for them. It's very hard to explain. I was not greeted warmly upon arrival (in fact, I was greeted as though I was an invading viking), I found it difficult to find help with my bags and it took them half an hour to order me a taxi. They made no attempt to congratulate either me or my bride, or any of my wedding party despite the fact that they knew it was our wedding night and they saw us return with flowing wedding dress and tux on our viking hides. The parking ends up costing nearly $50 a night, which I find very strange. It's not as if the hotel isn't expensive enough.
reviews.title: Nice but service is suspect

reviews.text: The breakfast that we had at the hotel was another story. Firstly, the prices were all between $20 and $30 (for breakfast!). Then I discovered that there was a strange black mold on the bottom of a pastry I was eating. I showed it to the waiter (who was the slowest waiter in history) and he came back without an apology, claiming it was charcoal from the pan it was baked on. He chuckled along with us (although we were laughing at his ludicrously bad service) and offered me another. Frankly, he should have given me the breakfast for free. Ridiculous.
reviews.title: Good!

likes.liked: — How clean it was and location.

reviews.text: I won't stay at the Amarano next time I'm in Burbank, which is a town sorely lacking in decent hotels. I wish I had have taken a taxi into Hollywood, where good hotels abound in this price range. The price of parking your car at the Amarano would alone cover the taxi fare to Hollywood.
reviews.title: Going Going Gone

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel to attend my daughter's wedding. When we booked the rooms and made arrangements in August 2007, it was still the Graciela. The lobby is nice, the rooms are decent size, but the service was not good. Our room was not cleaned at all our first day there, and we were out of the room for several hours. At 5:00, I heard some racket in the hall and it was the cleaning crew arguing, loudly, with their supervisor. The supervisor was pleasant when I asked for some additional towels and she brought them right away, as well as emptied our trash which was full. Day two the room was cleaned but not well at all. There was still hair on the bathroom floor! I don't know that I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Be Aware

reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay. The rooms are first class, the service outstanding and the location perfect for my work. What really stood out was the honesty of the staff. I left $700 in my room and noticed at the airport I could not find the money. I remember exactly where I left it, in the bedside drawer. I thought for sure it was gone. I called the hotel manager and was told the maid turned it in. This was a Saturday and he told me he was going to call my company on Monday to inform them I left the money behind. I can say this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I will return and recommend it to everyone.Thank you Graciela.
reviews.title: Honestly Amazed
My new favorite hotel in L.A.
reviews.text: first class accomodations. elegant, stylish, comfortable and quiet. a great location, a bit off the beaten track, but very close to all the action. The staff is professional and quick to please.
the employees were great. the hotel was fabulous! i would recommend it to everyone
reviews.title: it was awesome!
99% perfect stay
reviews.text: The missing 1% was for the slow service in the dining room during breakfast and the need to take a cab to go out anywhere vaguely exciting. But the 99% perfection goes to the hotel having great rooms, really comfortable beds, lovely Molton Brown toiletries, a boutique hotel atmosphere and nice bar area. Will always go back and stay at the Graciela when in Burbank.

What an amazing stay my family and I had at the Graciela Hotel in Burbank. The wonderful staff, food, the activities... the list goes on and on. My wife and I will not think about staying anywhere else bu here when we come back next year. Our kids had a blast with everything the hotel had to offer. Such a polite and serving staff... they were always going above and beyond of what we were expecting from anywhere else. So much to do in the local area!! Thank you for giving my family and I this wonderful experiance!!
reviews.title: Finally a place for the whole Family!!!

description: Hotel Amarano Burbank is the only luxury boutique hotel in Burbank, California. We welcome our guests with personalized service, elegant room and suite accommodations, and an intimate atmosphere.With only 100 rooms and suites at our boutique Burbank hotel, we provide individualized attention to our guests and their unique needs. Because we are a "home away from home" for so many of our guests, many of our accommodations have full kitchenettes and walk in closets. Spacious and stylishly designed, our uniquely crafted Burbank hideaway seamlessly blends upscale tranquility with affordable luxury. Our accommodations in Burbank are perfect for business, leisure or long term stays in Los Angeles, Hollywood and the Media District.Our luxury Burbank hotel is located in the heart of the entertainment capital of the world, around the corner from Warner Bros. Studios, one mile from Universal Studios, and only minutes away from NBC Studios and The Tonight Show with Jay Leno. Hotel Amarano is also convenient to all other media centers and studios including Paramount Pictures, ABC Studios, DreamWorks Animation Studios, Capitol Records and Turner Broadcasting along with Hollywood Bowl, Pantages Theater and Hollywood Blvd.
